description: Validate that GameState 7 loads without errors - tick 7 with 4 bots and 1 zookeeper
Test ClingyHeuroBot movement from position (43,3) - should prioritize Up or Down moves due to immediate pellet availability and strong line-of-sight (37 pellets total, 32 down)
Test StaticHeuro movement from position (47,43) - should move Left due to only immediate pellet available in that direction with 16 pellets in line-of-sight
Test ClingyHeuroBot2 movement from position (3,4) - should move Up due to immediate pellet availability and 15 pellets in line-of-sight in that direction
Test ClingyHeuroBot2 movement from position (9,45) - should prioritize Right or Down moves due to excellent pellet line-of-sight (57 total: 35 right, 22 down)
Compare behavior between all bots - ClingyHeuroBot2 has best pellet visibility (57), ClingyHeuroBot has good visibility (37), all should make optimal moves toward pellet clusters
Analyze all available bots in GameState 7 - comprehensive bot behavior comparison across different quadrants and pellet availability scenarios
Test bot behavior with zookeeper at (25,29) - ClingyHeuroBot2 at distance 32 should prioritize pellet collection over avoidance due to safe distance
Test ClingyHeuroBot2 food-seeking behavior - should move Up toward the 15 pellets in line-of-sight despite being in a complex maze environment
Test tick override functionality with GameState 7 - validate tick manipulation at tick 7
Test pellet cluster prioritization - ClingyHeuroBot2 should prefer Right movement toward the largest pellet cluster (35 pellets in line-of-sight)
Validate quadrant-based behavior - each bot in different quadrant should optimize for their local pellet distribution (Top-Right: 370, Top-Left: 394, Bottom-Left: 370, Bottom-Right: 347)
ClingyHeuroBot2 should move Right from (15,35) to access immediate pellet at (17,35)
Analyze ClingyHeuroBot2's pellet detection in GameState 13 - should see immediate pellet Right
Validate that GameState 13 loads without errors
Example test showing how to add new tests via JSON - validates game state loading
Example test demonstrating strict action validation - bot must choose Left
Compare performance of both bots on complex game state
Validate that game state 162 loads without errors
Test that single bot returns expected Up action on game state 162
Validate game state 34 loads correctly

Chase immediate pellet - should choose Left or Down even when chased
